result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob John Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:09 AM Defendant Jacob John Jones in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jacob John Jones.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. State recites agreement that count 1 be amended to 961.41(3g)(d) Misdemeanor possession of amphetamine and Count 2. For Count 1, 180 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Time concurrent to Count 2. Conditions of probation include serve 1 day jail with credit for 1 day served, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $50 fine plus costs. For Count 2, 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Concurrent to Count 1. Conditions of probation include serve 1 day jail with credit for 1 day served, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $50 fine plus costs. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Nelsen asks that the complaint be used to stipulate factual basis. Court stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered.

Court imposes for amended Count 1, 180 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Jail time and probation concurrent to Count 2. Conditions of probation include serve 1 day jail with credit for 1 day served, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC and pay a $50 fine plus costs. For Count 2, 90 days jail imposed and stayed for 2 years probation. Concurrent to Count 1. Conditions of probation include serve 1 day jail with credit for 1 day served and comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC.

10:16 AM Defendant Jacob John Jones in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jacob John Jones.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates offer extended some time ago. Has not received AODA documentation.  Attorney Nelson indicated completed treatment. Will get AODA records to state. Asks for status. Court sets date.
Status conference scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:35 AM Defendant Jacob John Jones in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jacob John Jones.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, pleads not guilty. Attorney Nelson indicates completing treatment. State would like documentation. Asks for status.
Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.
No violent or abusive contact with Victim 1.No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
Stipulation and Order Modifying Bond Conditions
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt:
10:47 AM Defendant Jacob John Jones in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Jacob John Jones.  Attorney Chad C La Lor in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State calls Officer Matthew Swanson sworn and he testifies.
4-19-22 1:10 AM 718 22nd Ave E Superior WI, Douglas county.
Observed vehicle Impala, Mr. Jones identified himself to Officer Johnson. 
Officer describes Dfd. State ask record ID Dfd.
No response from Atty Nelson.
Court record will reflect identification.
Found small bag of white crystal like substance in cigarette pack that Officer Johnson put on top of vehicle. Positive test for meth. 
No questions from Mr. Nelson
No more witness from State.
No witness for Atty Nelson. 
State asks bind over.
Atty Nelson oppose bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for arraignment. 
Set ARG 7-29-22 @ 9:30 
Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 9:30
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
